izzy.features.granulate¶

izzy.features.granulate(x, bins=None, mode=None, retbins=False)[source]¶

Transforms x into coarse bins

Parameters

  • x (ArrayLike) – Array to granulate

  • bins (int or ArrayLike) – If int, produce that many bins according to mode; otherwise, use bins

  • mode (str) – Options include ‘quantile’, ‘equal’, ‘left-equal’, ‘right-equal’, ‘binary’, or ‘distinct’. Note that ‘equal’ and ‘left-equal’ are synonyms. If mode = ‘distinct’, no transformation is performed. The mode = ‘binary’ is the same as ‘distinct’, except that we check that there are only two types of observations.

  • retbins (bool) – Should the bins be returned?

Returns

Granulated array and (optional) bins

Return type

ArrayLike or (ArrayLike, ArrayLike)
